title: ZZ Top’s ‘Rio Grande Mud’ at 50
sub_head: The album was the first to showcase the group’s fully formed hard-rock boogie blues.
body: When ZZ Top released its second studio album, “Rio Grande Mud,” 50 years ago on April 4, a 1972 newspaper ad promoted the band as a Texas phenomenon that was leaving a mark on Southern rock. The mention of Texas in a rock ad back then was an eyebrow-raiser.
